body.draft-comment: This topic will describe where are the Webhelp templates stored and which is the structure of an webhelp template.
body.p: All the Webhelp templates are stored in the templates folder located in the root folder of the webhelp plugin. The structure of an Webhelp template is the following:
At the first level of the template directory we can find the predefined directories resources and variants that will be copied to the output in the {outDir}/oxygen-webhep/template directory.
Also this folder contains all the HTML template pages used to generate the Webhelp pages:

ul.li: wt_index.html - Used to generate main page.
wt_topic.html - Used to generate HTML pages for each DITA topic.
wt_search - Used to generate the HTML page for presenting the search result.
wt_terms - Used to generate the page for index terms.

section.title: Template, variant and skin concept
section.p: An HTML template could be seen as a set WebHelp component that are put in a predefined HTML layout.

If we option the displaying of one of more template's components we could obtain one or more variants of the template. So, a WebHelp template variant is an instance of the template with a specific set of parameters. For instance, we could have two variants of the WebHelp main page, one that displays the topics as tiles and another that displays the map topics from the first level in a tree-like fashion.
Each variant has its own directory which gives the name of the variant. The name of the variant is displayed also by UI when you choose a variant.
The variant's directory could contains the following resources:

ul.li: params.properties - This file specifies the values for the parameters imposed by this variant.
resources - if this folder exist it should contains resources that are specific for a variant. They will be copied to the output directory.
one or more skins directories that represents custom skins of a variant.

section.p: A variant's skin represents a custom CSS together with some additional resources referenced by this skin (images, fonts). The name of the skin directory will give the name of the skin and it will be displayed in the UI when you choose a variant's skin.

The CSS associated with a skin should be named skin.css and it should exists as first child of the skin's directory. The additional resources that are specific for this skin should stay in the resources directory as first level for the skin directory.
